title: copycat
text: know many times searched within old scripts, especially ggplot command used many times, forgotten details. reason started create package. CopyCat comes small data set (CopyCatCode) contains minimal examples several cheat sheets run without ado. example, let’s look minimal examples ggplot2 package. CopyCatCode data provides package name, function, code minimal example: Let’s say remember pivot_longer tidyr package works. Just search corresponding code snippet via copycat() function, searches code snippet saves returned code clipboard. see code returned, use corresponding copycat_code() function. Since code based implemented data – examples listed CopyCat – can see works just pasting console. Alternatively, set run option TRUE copycat() sends code console. course, minimal examples run package loaded time know package name. However, sometimes look package name use function often. copycat_package() function returns corresponding package name sends code library(...) directly console. copycat_package() function copies code also clipboard, since want insert script well. add typos accident, sure whether function written small large caps, might lucky similar match found data. Unfortunately, works match found .
code:
## load library and provide a data frame  library(copycat)  CopyCatCode %>%    filter(package == "ggplot2") %>%    arrange(fct) #> # A tibble: 46 × 3 #>    package fct          code                                                     #>    <chr>   <chr>        <chr>                                                    #>  1 ggplot2 annotate     "ggplot(mtcars, aes(x=mpg)) +   
  geom_histogram(co… #>  2 ggplot2 facet_grid   "ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg)) + 
  geom_blank() + … #>  3 ggplot2 facet_wrap   "ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg)) + 
  geom_blank() + … #>  4 ggplot2 geom_abline  "ggplot(mpg, aes(cty, hwy))+
  geom_point()+
  ge… #>  5 ggplot2 geom_area    "ggplot(mpg, aes(hwy))+
  geom_area(stat = "bin")"  #>  6 ggplot2 geom_bar     "ggplot(data=mpg, aes(x=class)) + geom_bar()"            #>  7 ggplot2 geom_bin2d   "ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price))+ geom_bin2d(binwid… #>  8 ggplot2 geom_boxplot "ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=color, y=carat, fill=color)) +\… #>  9 ggplot2 geom_col     "ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=color, y=carat)) +
  geom_co… #> 10 ggplot2 geom_contour "ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, z = density)… #> # … with 36 more rows # copycat("pivot_longer") saves the returned code to the clipboad #>[1] "🐈 Your code: relig_income %>% tidyr::pivot_longer(!religion, names_to = #>'income', values_to = 'count')" # copycat_code() let us inspect what the function returned  copycat_code("pivot_longer") #> [1] "🐈 Your code: relig_income %>% tidyr::pivot_longer(!religion, names_to = 'income', values_to = 'count')" copycat("pivot_longer", run = T ) relig_income %>%    pivot_longer(!religion, names_to = 'income', values_to = 'count') #> # A tibble: 180 × 3 #>    religion income             count #>    <chr>    <chr>              <dbl> #>  1 Agnostic <$10k                 27 #>  2 Agnostic $10-20k               34 #>  3 Agnostic $20-30k               60 #>  4 Agnostic $30-40k               81 #>  5 Agnostic $40-50k               76 #>  6 Agnostic $50-75k              137 #>  7 Agnostic $75-100k             122 #>  8 Agnostic $100-150k            109 #>  9 Agnostic >150k                 84 #> 10 Agnostic Don't know/refused    96 #> # … with 170 more rows #search for a package name, copies the load and loads the library copycat_package("pivot_longer") #>[1] [1] "🐈 Mission accomplished, loaded and copied library: tidyr" #typos and other mistakes  copycat_package("bivot") #> [1] "Did you mean pivot_longer from the tidyr package?" #> [2] "Did you mean pivot_wider from the tidyr package?" copycat("bivatasa") #>[1] "💩 Sooorry, I've got no idea what you are looking for!"

title: copycat
text: CopyCat can also connected Github repository copy one old scripts. First, setup Github account details, CopyCat search. Provide name author, repository, branch name. copycat_gitsearch() function uses Github API search within repository returns R scripts live within repository copycat_git() function copies code clipboard.
code: git_setup <- c(author = "edgar-treischl",                repository = "Illustrations",                branch = "master") copycat_gitsearch() #> # A tibble: 4 × 1 #>   git_scripts              #>   <chr>                    #> 1 R/anscombe_quartet.R     #> 2 R/boxplot_illustration.R #> 3 R/boxplot_pitfalls.R     #> 4 R/datasaurus.R copycat_git("boxplot_illustration") #>[1] "🐈 Mission accomplished!"

title: copycat
text: Often, need code runs see functions work. reason, CopyCat search within R help files vignettes, returns code listed vignette examples help file. copycat_helpsearch() function list help files package: copycat_help() function copies examples section help file clipboard. , see actually copied, corresponding copycat_helpcode function return code. function exist search copy code vignettes. copycat_vigsearch() returns availabe vignettes. copycat_vignette() copies entire script. copy smaller code chunks clipboard fine. Helpfiles especially vignettes much longer. Therefore, create new file paste code file. copycat_helpscript()create new script examples help file, copycat_vigscript() code vignette. CopyCat started personal package. Feel free use manage code snippets . Just add data frame variable names small example data (CopyCatCode) CopyCat handles snippets.
code: copycat_helpsearch("tidyr") #>  [1] "billboard"         "chop"              "complete"          #>  [4] "construction"      "deprecated-se"     "drop_na"           #>  [7] "expand"            "expand_grid"       "extract"           #> [10] "extract_numeric"   "fill"              "fish_encounters"   #> [13] "full_seq"          "gather"            "hoist"             #> [16] "nest"              "nest_legacy"       "pack"              #> [19] "pipe"              "pivot_longer"      "pivot_longer_spec" #> [22] "pivot_wider"       "pivot_wider_spec"  "reexports"         #> [25] "relig_income"      "replace_na"        "separate"          #> [28] "separate_rows"     "smiths"            "spread"            #> [31] "table1"            "tidyr-package"     "tidyr_legacy"      #> [34] "tidyr_tidy_select" "uncount"           "unite"             #> [37] "us_rent_income"    "who"               "world_bank_pop" #copycat_help() saves examples of the help files into your clipboard #copycat_help("tidyr", "drop_na") copycat_helpcode("tidyr", "drop_na") #> [1] "#Extracted examples:"                                        #> [2] "     library(dplyr)"                                         #> [3] "     df <- tibble(x = c(1, 2, NA), y = c(\"a\", NA, \"b\"))" #> [4] "     df %>% drop_na()"                                       #> [5] "     df %>% drop_na(x)"                                      #> [6] "     "                                                       #> [7] "     vars <- \"y\""                                          #> [8] "     df %>% drop_na(x, any_of(vars))"                        #> [9] "     " copycat_vigsearch("tidyr") #> [1] "nest.R"        "pivot.R"       "programming.R" "rectangle.R"   #> [5] "tidy-data.R"   "in-packages.R" copycat_vignette("tidyr", "pivot") #> "😎 copied that!" copycat_helpscript("tidyr", "pivot") copycat_vigscript("tidyr", "pivot")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Treischl E (2022). copycat: Search copy code snippets. https://github.com/edgar-treischl/CopyCat, https://edgar-treischl.github.io/CopyCat/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {copycat: Search and copy your code snippets},   author = {Edgar Treischl},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/edgar-treischl/CopyCat, https://edgar-treischl.github.io/CopyCat/}, }

what: Search and copy your code snippets
title: Search and copy your code snippets
text: CopyCat small personal package copy, paste, view code snippets. provided code snippets minimal examples based code runs implemented data, helps R learner see code works. CopyCat uses three different code sources. First, CopyCat comes small data frame includes code snippets cheat sheets ggplot2 tidyr package. course, can use code snippets data source well. Second, CopyCat can fetch copy code lives Github. Ultimately, CopyCat searches also within R help files vignettes code illustrates function works. Thus, CopyCat built personal package lazy cats, also help new R learner manage code snippets.

title: Search and copy your code snippets

title: Search and copy your code snippets
text: CopyCat can also connected Github repository copy one old scripts. First, setup Github account details, CopyCat search. Provide name author, repository, branch name. copycat_gitsearch() function uses Github API search within repository returns R scripts live within repository copycat_git() function copies code clipboard.
code: git_setup <- c(author = "edgar-treischl",                repository = "Illustrations",                branch = "master") copycat_gitsearch() #> # A tibble: 5 × 1 #>   git_scripts              #>   <chr>                    #> 1 R/Simpsons_Paradox.R     #> 2 R/anscombe_quartet.R     #> 3 R/boxplot_illustration.R #> 4 R/boxplot_pitfalls.R     #> 5 R/datasaurus.R copycat_git("boxplot_illustration") #>[1] "🐈 Mission accomplished!"

title: Search and copy your code snippets
text: Often, need code runs see functions work. reason, CopyCat search within R help files vignettes, returns code listed vignette examples help file. copycat_helpsearch() function list help files package: copycat_help() function copies examples section help file clipboard. , see actually copied, corresponding copycat_helpcode function return code. function exist search copy code vignettes. copycat_vigsearch() returns availabe vignettes. copycat_vignette() copies entire script. copy smaller code chunks clipboard fine. Helpfiles especially vignettes much longer. Therefore, create new file paste code file. copycat_helpscript()create new script examples help file, copycat_vigscript() code vignette. CopyCat started personal package. Feel free use manage code snippets . Just add data frame variable names small example data (CopyCatCode) CopyCat handles snippets.

title: Copy Cat Code: — CopyCatCode
text: data set containing minimal examples code snippets run implemented data.

title: Copy Cat Code: — CopyCatCode
text: data frame 41 rows 3 variables: package R package name fct function name code code snippet

title: copycat — copycat
text: x search string data Data run TRUE FALSE

title: copycat_code — copycat_code
text: `copycat_code()` uses text string search code function. function just returns code. expects data frame three columns. column package name (package), function (fun), one code (code) copy. data = NULL, `copycat_code()` relies `CopyCatCode`.

title: copycat_code — copycat_code
text: x search string function data data frame

title: copycat_gitsearch — copycat_gitsearch
text: author character vector. repository character vector. branch character vector.

title: copycat_help — copycat_help
text: pkg search string fn search string

title: copycat_helpcode — copycat_helpcode
text: pkg search string fn search string

title: copycat_helpscript — copycat_helpscript
text: pkg search string fn search string path search string

title: copycat_vignette — copycat_vignette
text: pkg search string vig search string

title: copycat_vigscript — copycat_vigscript
text: pkg search string vig search string
